documentation.text:
@param challenge is the challenge string, basically a random input of arbitrary length
 
 summary:
 challenge = "apple"
 target = "cd25"
 returns keccak256("apple") == 0x??...??cd25 (so returns true)
find out if the hash covers one of the tier masks, if so, return the tier name string.
Takes the sub-bitstring specified by start- and end_index, shifts it all the way to the right, and returns it.

attributes.text:
@param challenge is the challenge string, basically a random input of arbitrary length
 
 summary:
 challenge = "apple"
 target = "cd25"
 returns keccak256("apple") == 0x??...??cd25 (so returns true)
find out if the hash covers one of the tier masks, if so, return the tier name string.
Takes the sub-bitstring specified by start- and end_index, shifts it all the way to the right, and returns it.

params.challenge: is the challenge string, basically a random input of arbitrary length  summary: challenge = "apple" target = "cd25" returns keccak256("apple") == 0x??...??cd25 (so returns true)

find_present_tier(bytes32).notice: find out if the hash covers one of the tier masks, if so, return the tier name string.
